intro: Floscopa pusilla, commonly known as the dwarf floscopa, is a small flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of less than 10 centimeters, with narrow, grass-like leaves and small yellow flowers. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in grasslands and along riverbanks. Due to its size and habitat, it is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
